Incident.Summary: While conducting traffic enforcement the phone was discovered on the right shoulder of westbound Interstate 68 at the end of the on ramp from Pleasant Valley Road.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: FOUND PROPERTY On Friday, December 29, 2023, at approximately 1155 hours I, ST. E. Wilson #6100, discovered a cell phone in pieces on the right shoulder of westbound Interstate 68 at the end of the on ramp from Pleasant Valley Road. The phone was laying in scattered in several pieces (the phone, back place, battery, and case). The phone was faced down on the pavement. When I picked it up the screen was significantly cracked and parts of glass fell out. The SIM card was still in place. I put the battery in the phone and pressed the power button to attempt to contact someone to return it to the owner. The phone vibrated, but the screen did not illuminate due to the damage. It is suspected that the phone was recently left on the roof of a vehicle based on the condition and location. The phone is a silver Samsung Galaxy J7 V (Phone model: SM-J727V N, IMEI: 352716085202427, FCCID: A3LSNJ727V) with a black Otterbox case. The phone provider, Verizon, is printed on the back-plate that conceals the battery. I gathered the remaining parts and placed it in a Ziploc baggie. I responded to the only Verizon location in Allegany County located at58 S Centre St, Cumberland, MD 21502 for assistance to locate the owner. The entrance to the building was locked, and I attempted the entire series of switches on the intercom to speak with an employee. There was no response. I called a Hagerstown Verizon cell phone store at 240-329-4263 to determine the owner using the identifying information to the phone. I was advised that Customer Care would be able to use the IMEI number, and my call was transferred. After an extensive amount of time on hold with no contact from a person or options to speak with another department; I terminated the phone call. After exhausting all immediate options I took the phone to the Maryland State Police Cumberland Barrack. On Saturday, December 30, 2023, at approximately 1123 hours I contacted another Verizon store in Hagerstown, Maryland at 240-707-6790. I spoke with associate Hector who was able to immediately provide assistance. The search of the IMEI revealed the account owner as Candice Destefano. Notes on the account indicated that the device was removed from an active status on 12/26/2023 and the associated phone number is 740-381-1270. The phone number was called since a new phone may have been obtained and there was no answer. A TLO search was conducted and contact was made with Carmen Destefano (DOB:12/9/1947) at his home phone of 740-264-2630. Carmen advised that he is the owner of the phone and Candice is his wife. Carmen lives in Steubenville, Ohio and had stayed at Rocky Gap Resort twice in the last two weeks (12/21/23 and 12/28/23). Carmen requested the phone be destroyed due to the distance from his home, the condition, the since having been replaced. The phone was submitted in the Cumberland Barrack Temporary Storage for destruction at 1220 hours. All the above occurred in Allegany County, Maryland. The property owner/victim is aware of the case status. Case CLOSED. (Property owner found.)

IncidentProperty.Description: Silver Samsung Galaxy J7V cellphone with black "Otterbox" case.
